law.catch_line: Materials to accompany application -- Investigation fee.
law.text:
Each application for a license shall be accompanied by:
An investigation fee of five hundred dollars ($500) for Kentucky residents and five hundred dollars ($500) for nonresidents of Kentucky for each location which shall not be subject to refund but which, if the license is granted, shall constitute the license fee for the first license year or part thereof;
Audited financial statements prescribed by the commissioner; and
Evidence that the applicant has complied or will comply with all workers', and unemployment compensation laws of Kentucky.
law.history: Amended 2010 Ky. Acts ch. 24, sec. 802, effective July 15, 2010. -- Amended 1998 Ky. Acts ch. 601, sec. 5, effective April 14, 1998. -- Created 1992 Ky. Acts ch. 213, sec. 6, effective July 14, 1992; and ch. 341, sec. 6, effective July 14, 1992.

metadata.lrc-note: (7/12/2006). In accordance with 2006 Ky. Acts ch. 247, secs. 38 and 39, this statute has been renumbered as a section of the Kentucky Financial Services Code, KRS Chapter 286.
